entry.title: Centos Notes
entry.content:
Adding, Enabling, and Disabling a Yum Repository

yum-config-manager --add-repo repository_url
yum-config-manager --enable repository…
yum-config-manager --disable repository…

List repo for centos: * http://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/6/x86_64/ * http://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/

Fix error no key

wget http://ftp.riken.jp/Linux/fedora/epel/RPM-GPG-KEY-EPEL-6
rpm -import RPM-GPG-KEY-EPEL-6
rm -f RPM-GPG-KEY-EPEL-6

rpm --import http://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/RPM-GPG-KEY-EPEL-6

You need to install and configure ntp.

$ yum install ntp
$ chkconfig ntpd on
$ ntpdate pool.ntp.org
$ service ntpd start

Download using wget or curl

$ wget -O ...
$ curl -O ...

Copy file to clipboard

$ xclip -sel clip < ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub

Make simple server with python

$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8080

Install nodejs

Run as root on RHEL, CentOS or Fedora, for Node.js v4 LTS Argon: $ curl --silent --location https://rpm.nodesource.com/setup_4.x | bash -

Alternatively for Node.js v6: $ curl --silent --location https://rpm.nodesource.com/setup_6.x | bash -

Alternatively for Node.js 0.10: $ curl --silent --location https://rpm.nodesource.com/setup | bash -

Then install, as root: $ yum -y install nodejs

Install development tools

$ sudo yum groupinstall "Development Tools"

Zip

Zip folder to file $ zip -r file_name.zip /path/of/folder/

Auto start service

Add it to chkconfig $ sudo /sbin/chkconfig --add mysqld

Make sure it is in the chkconfig. $ sudo /sbin/chkconfig --list mysqld

Set it to autostart $ sudo /sbin/chkconfig mysqld on

To stop a service from auto starting on boot $ sudo /sbin/chkconfig mysqld off

Find text in folder

$ grep -rnw './' -e ""
